title: After yet another school shooting, familiar arguments from Biden, lawmakers
description: Despite outrage over the Nashville school shooting, politicians in Washington and President Joe Biden returned to the same arguments when asked why more can't be done.

title: Austin confronts GOP senator for blocking military nominations over abortion policy
description: Tuberville has been blocking military nominations since last month, over the Pentagon’s abortion policy that covers travel costs of service members seeking the care.

title: Loose barge carrying toxic alcohol compound partially submerged at Ohio River dam
description: A set of locks for an Ohio River dam in Kentucky is closed due to a "navigational incident" after 10 barges were released from a tugboat.

title: Kamala Harris grows emotional describing 'blood' and 'crimes' at infamous slave post
description: Kamala Harris was visibly moved by what she saw Tuesday at Cape Coast Castle in Ghana, where millions of Africans were held captive

title: Nashville school shooting puts renewed focus on doors, security
description: Security video from inside Covenant School in Nashville, Tennessee, captured the shooter who killed six people, including three children, blasting through a glass door.

title: Friend contacted authorities after speaking to Nashville shooter on morning of attack
description: A friend of Nashville shooter Audrey Hale tells ABC News that she contacted authorities Monday morning after Hale messaged her online about "planning to die today."

title: Nashville vs. Uvalde shootings: A contrast in police responses
description: "They trained for that. And this moment happened and they didn’t hesitate at all."

title: Nashville fire chief reflects on first responders actions on Covenant School shooting
description: Nashville Fire Chief William Swann spoke with GMA 3 Tuesday about the first responders who sped to Covenant School after six people were shot.

title: Adnan Syed murder conviction reinstated by Maryland appeals court
description: He was the subject of the popular "Serial" podcast.

title: Judge rejects Trump's privilege claims over Pence testimony in Jan. 6 probe
description: A judge has rejected former President Trump's assertion of executive privilege to keep former Vice President Pence from testifying about efforts to overturn the election.

title: House Republicans ramp up investigation into Afghanistan withdrawal
description: The GOP-led panel subpoenaed Secretary of State Antony Blinken Tuesday.

title: WATCH:  Black Labrador has cutest reaction when told he's going to see grandparents
description: Sully the Labrador retriever loves his grandparents' house!

title: Minnesota youth vaping trial of e-cigarette maker Juul opens
description: Minnesota Attorney General Keith Ellison plans to lead the opening statements Tuesday in his state’s lawsuit against Juul Labs

title: McCarthy calls on Biden to schedule meeting on debt ceiling
description: Republican House Speaker Kevin McCarthy says he’s growing increasingly concerned about President Joe Biden’s unwillingness to negotiate on lifting the nation’s borrowing authority

title: 1 in 12 kids lose a parent or sibling before turning 18: Report
description: Kids in certain states like West Virginia are at a higher risk.

title: WATCH:  Dash camera captures wild Los Angeles crash
description: Police say the driver of an SUV suffered minor injuries after a wheel separated from a white pickup truck and crashed into the SUV again.

title: Disgraced crypto exec Sam Bankman-Fried faces new bribery charge
description: Embattled crypto executive Sam Bankman-Fried now faces a criminal charge of conspiracy to violate the anti-bribery provisions of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act.

title: How 2 cities rebuilt after tornadoes and why they may be models for others
description: As small towns recover after a weekend of deadly tornadoes, community leaders across the Mississippi Delta are beginning to confront how to rebuild.

title: Honda recalls more than 330,000 vehicles due to mirror issue
description: Honda is recalling more than 330,000 vehicles because heating pads behind both side-view mirrors may not be bonded properly, which could lead to the mirror glass falling out and increase the risk of a crash

title: Push in states for $20 minimum wage as inflation persists
description: Just years after labor activists persuaded a handful of states to raise their minimum wage to $15 per hour, workers initially thrilled with the pay bump are finding their hard-won gains erased by inflation

title: MI5 hikes Northern Ireland terror threat level to 'severe'
description: The U.K.’s MI5 intelligence service has raised the terrorism threat level in Northern Ireland’ to “severe.”

title: Hundreds of fencers protest against letting Russians compete
description: More than 300 fencers including nine medalists from the last Olympics in Tokyo have signed an open letter urging the sport’s governing body and the International Olympic Committee not to allow Russian fencers to compete while the war in Ukraine continues

title: Portugal: 2 dead, several injured in Muslim center stabbing
description: Portuguese police have shot and injured a man suspected of stabbing two women to death at an Ismaili Muslim center in Lisbon

title: US opens investigation into Tesla seat belts coming loose
description: U.S. highway safety regulators have opened an investigation into complaints that Tesla seat belts may not hold people in a crash

title: 4 teachers, 2 students stabbed in Brazilian school
description: A 13-year-old student stabbed four teachers and two other students at a school in São Paulo, Brazil, on Monday, officials said.

title: Nashville school shooting updates: Authorities search for answers with motive unknown
description: Authorities are searching for answers after a shooter killed six people at a private Christian elementary school in Nashville, Tennessee.

title: WATCH:  Skiers witness massive avalanche in Utah
description: The skiers were swamped by a powder cloud but no one was injured.

title: WATCH:  Dazzling aurora shines over bioluminescent waves
description: Time-lapse footage shows a dazzling natural light show in Tasmania.

title: 39 dead after fire breaks out at migrant detention center in Juarez, Mexico
description: A fire broke out in the Instituto Nacional de Migración, a detention center in Ciudad Juarez, Mexico, on Monday.

title: Police in Belgium arrest 8 people in counterterrorism raids
description: Police officers in Belgium have arrested eight people during counterterrorism raids across the country as part of operations aimed at thwarting possible terror attacks

title: Lawmakers vote on Paris Olympic law with surveillance fears
description: A proposed French law for the 2024 Paris Olympics that critics contend will open the door for privacy-busting video surveillance technology in Europe faces an important hurdle with French lawmakers set to vote on it

title: Greek prime minister calls general election for May 21
description: Greece’s center-right Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis has called a general election on May 21 in the aftermath of a train disaster that has reduced his party’s long-standing majority in opinion polls

title: WATCH:  9 Congolese miners escape from collapsed gold mine
description: Onlookers cried out in joy as nine Congolese miners escaped from a collapsed gold mine.

title: Doctor decries gun violence after school shooting near miss
description: A pediatric surgeon who left The Covenant School in Nashville moments before a shooter opened fire, killing six people, says she is horrified by the gun violence that has plagued the U.S. Britney Grayson had just finished regaling children about Kenya,...

title: U.S. renewable electricity surpassed coal in 2022
description: The U.S. Energy Information Administration announced that electricity generated from renewables surpassed coal electricity production in the United States for the first time in 2022

title: Who was Nashville shooter Audrey Hale?
description: The shooter who attacked the Covenant School in Nashville was identified as 28-year-old Audrey Hale, who law enforcement said may have once attended the school.

title: Sen. Rand Paul staffer stabbed multiple times in DC, suspect arrested
description: A staffer for Rand Paul was stabbed and seriously injured in Washington, D.C., on Saturday and a suspect has since been arrested, according to police and Paul's office
